intro: Commelina axillaris, commonly known as the small-leaf commelina, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Commelina axillaris is characterized by its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in ecological systems as a source of nectar for pollinators.
